descript.abstract: This product will aid in the visualization of an NHC official track forecast, the forecast points are connected by black line segments. The track line(s) are not a forecast product, however, and because there are an infinite number of ways to connect a set of forecast points, the lines should not be interpreted as representing a specific forecast for the location of a tropical cyclone in between official forecast points. It is also important to remember that tropical cyclone track forecasts are subject to error, and that the effects of a tropical cyclone can span many hundreds of miles from the center.
descript.purpose: The NHC official track forecast in shapefile format is intended to aid in the visualization of an NHC official track forecast

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgement of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Weather Service, National Centers for Environmental Prediction or the National Hurricane Center would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

cntperp.cntorg: National Hurricane Center / Technical Support Branch

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: name given to each tropical cyclone for which the National Hurricane Center is writing forecast advisories
the date in which an advisory is issued
the sequential numbering of forecast advisories for each tropical cyclone
the sequential numbering of tropical cyclones for a specific forecast basin according to when the first advisory is issued
the time interval for which the forecast of a tropical cyclone is provided in graphical format
the ocean where the tropical cyclone is located
category of the tropical cyclone according to the initial intensity

distinfo.distliab: No responsibility is assumed by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration in the use of these data.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
